itemDescription: British swimmer, Olympic athlete, Commonwealth Games silver medallist, journalist

wikipedia_page.main: James Guy Parrack (born 10 March 1967, Cheltenham, England) is a male English sports journalist and former competitive swimmer.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1988 Summer Olympics

response: British sports journalist and former swimmer James Parrack has described Yeiyah as having "great potential" and has suggested that he specialise to maximise this.

link_mentions.page: Swimming at the 1988 Summer Olympics – Men's 100 metre breaststroke

response: Metcalfe missed out on a place for the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona in circumstances of some controversy. Metcalfe achieved the qualification time and came second in the UK Olympic trials behind Foster. However Metcalfe missed out due to Fibbens having been pre-selected for winning a bronze from Swimming at the 1991 European Aquatics Championships. The subject was later raised again by James Parrack in his April 2004 column in Swimming magazine.http://www.pullbuoy.co.uk/fosterchat2.html
*James Parrack (born 1967), English sports journalist and former swimmer
